channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Bangladesh diplomats to return after talks on December 9
item.description: Following attacks on Bangladesh's diplomatic missions in India and alleged desecration of its flag, two Bangladeshi diplomats are set to return to their posts after foreign secretary-level talks between the two countries. Tensions escalated after reports of minority persecution in Bangladesh following the July uprising.

item.title: German far-right AfD leader is Chinese-speaking lesbian economist
item.description: Alice Weidel, the chancellor candidate for Germany's far-right AfD party, presents a unique profile. A lesbian raising a family with a Sri Lankan-born partner, Weidel's background contrasts with the party's traditional image. Analysts suggest this makes her an asset, broadening the AfD's appeal, while critics label her an opportunist.

item.title: Saudi royal slams 'genocidal' Israel, welcomes Trump
item.description: A senior Saudi royal termed Israel "genocidal" and an "apartheid" state on Saturday, as he called on incoming US President-elect Donald Trump to bring peace to the Middle East. "Friendly countries in the region are hoping that Mr. Trump pursues what he started before, to bring peace with capital letters to the Middle East," he said.

item.title: Trillion-dollar gap in Taiwan, Korea stock fortunes
item.description: Taiwan's stock market surges amidst the global AI boom, outpacing South Korea's struggling market. Taiwan's dominance in the semiconductor industry, particularly TSMC's success, fuels this growth. Meanwhile, South Korea grapples with political instability and Samsung's underperformance. Despite looming US tariff threats, Taiwan appears better positioned due to its crucial role in US tech supply chains.

item.title: CEO's shooting lays bare US' health cover woes
Hawk Tuah girl's attorney says she didn't intend to fleece fans after crypto crash
item.description: ​Crypto investigator Stephen Findeisen revealed that Hailey Welch was paid $125,000 in advance for marketing the token from an unspecified company, and was to receive 50 per cent of net proceeds from that company after third-party expenses and costs for the development and launch had been covered. Hailey Welch's attorney said she didn't intend to fleece fans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What! Was there a UnitedHealthcare CEO killer lookalike competition in New York?
item.description: A video of a man claiming to be the winner of a UnitedHealthcare CEO killer lookalike competition has gone viral. The competition, allegedly inspired by the recent murder of Brian Thompson, has sparked outrage and disbelief on social media. Participants wore similar hoodies to the killer and displayed posters with slogans matching the bullet casings found at the crime scene.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk spotted in Notre Dame reopening television footage, obliges fan with selfie
item.description: Elon Musk was inside Notre Dame as the cathedral reopened its door five years after it was ravaged by a fire in 2019. Musk was not a surprise guest as he was scheduled to land at 3.20 pm (1420 GMT) at Le Bourget airport today on his private jet. A viral video of the event shows Elon posing for a selfie with a woman.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: France's Notre Dame Cathedral reopens five years after devastating fire
item.description: Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris reopened Saturday, five years after a devastating fire. Archbishop Laurent Ulrich led a ceremony marking the completion of extensive restoration, attended by dignitaries and watched by crowds despite stormy weather. The $750 million project overcame numerous challenges. French President Macron hailed the reopening as a symbol of France's resilience. Public masses resume Sunday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Macron hosts talks over 'crazy world' with Zelenskyy and Trump in Paris
item.description: Presidents Macron, Zelensky, and Trump convened in Paris for trilateral talks addressing global concerns. Trump, on his first international trip since winning the US election, joined Macron at the Élysée Palace before attending the Notre Dame reopening.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NYPD may have UnitedHealthcare CEO's killer's name but 'we don't want to release...'
item.description: The NYPD is closing in on Brian Thompson's killer, Mayor Eric Adams confirmed. While the police may have identified the suspect, Adams stated they won't release the name yet to avoid tipping him off. He emphasized the meticulous investigation, assuring the public that the net is tightening and justice will be served.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump is back to dominate...': MAGA gives verdict after Donald's viral handshake with Macron
item.description: Donald Trump's handshake with French President Emmanuel Macron during his visit to Paris for the Norte Dame reopening became a viral moment they were seen caught in a moment of wrestling as to who would dominate whom. Donald Trump kept his hand in such a position that it became a vertical handshake and MAGA supporters cheered that Trump is back to dominate and rule.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy has a message to GOP Senators who don't want to confirm Trump's picks
item.description: "President Trump won by a massive margin with a historic mandate & he deserved the Cabinet he desires to govern," Ramaswamy issued a sweeping statement amid row over Pete Hegseth clouding his senate confirmation. Apart from Hegseth, Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard too may face challenges in Senate confirmation, according to reports.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: France's iconic Notre Dame Cathedral rises from ashes, to reopen 5 years after fire
Did UnitedHealthcare post a job ad for CEO soon after Brian Thompson's murder? Here's the truth
item.description: A fake job posting for UnitedHealthcare CEO went viral after Brian Thompson's murder, falsely suggesting the company was quickly seeking a replacement. UnitedHealthcare received a lot of flak as many social media users celebrated Brian Thompson's murder accusing his company of denying health insurance payout and thereby killing thousands every year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: One of Diddy's accusers reveals identity as ex-wife of this NHL star
item.description: Anna Kane, ex-wife of NHL player Evander Kane, publicly identified herself as one of the women accusing Sean "Diddy" Combs of rape and sexual assault. Kane alleges that when she was 17, she was drugged and gang-raped by Diddy, his friend Harve Pierre, and an unidentified man. She first used a pseudonym but now revealed her name as she said she is not intimidated to reveal her identity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Notre Dame to reopen five years after blaze; Trump, Zelenskyy, global leaders to attend grand ceremony
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Brian Thompson killer carry 'Peak Design' backpack? Company CEO says...
item.description: Peak Design's CEO, Paul Dering, said the backpack that the shooter of Brian Thompson was carrying might be an older model of their Everyday Backpack. A backpack has been found in Central Park and sent for forensic testing. It could be the bag the killer was seen carrying in the surveillance footage. He might have discarded it as he fled on a bike from the murder spot. Investigators believe the killer has fled out of NYC.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UnitedHealth Group CEO reacts to 'celebration' after Brian Thompson killing: 'Highly disrespectful'
item.description: The CEO of UnitedHealth Group, the mother company of UnitedHealthcare, Andrew Witty condemned the inappropriate comments being said on social media following the murder of Brian Thompson. Witty urged employees to avoid engaging with the media. ​"I'd like to give you little bit of advice around the media…My strong advice and request to everybody is just don't engage with the media. If you're approached, I would recommend not responding and, if necessary, simply refer them to our own media organization.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Let it play out': Trump says US should not get involved in Syria as rebels close in on Damascus
item.description: US President-elect Donald Trump urged the US to avoid involvement in the escalating Syrian conflict, where rebels are challenging President Assad's government. Trump believes Russia's potential exit from Syria could be beneficial. Meanwhile, Syrian rebels have launched a major offensive, encircling Damascus, prompting border closures by Lebanon and Jordan.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
